page.title: 15Health Clinic for Parbold?
page.content: { }The Committee are considering the case for a Health Clinic in Parbold, to serve about 5,000 people from Parbold, Newburgh, and Dalton. The local doctors have said that they do not want a Health Centre, so it is hoped that a clinic could provide help for young mothers, welfare food distribution, dental services, chiropody, etc. A single_storey building measuring about 25 sq. metres would be needed, together with parking space. The siting of the Centre would be in the area of the old Home Office Store. If the scheme was fully approved, then a period of about 8_10 years would be required before it was complete.
